title: /cons: switch gets ignored on latest 1.77.3 NB
author: brolifen
body_snippet:
When using the /cons cmd switch to load an existing connection file it gets ignored. Tried with and without quotes, local and file share unc's but nothing works.

## Expected Behavior
Load existing connection file using /cons: or /c: switch.

## Current Behavior
Acts like no connection file exists and asks to create one on first load. On subsequent loads it just uses the default connection file under the users appdata.

comments.author: BlueBlock
comments.snippet:
I'm unable to tell from the documentation:
https://mremoteng.readthedocs.io/en/v1.77.3-dev/command_line_switches.html

Is the expectation that setting /cons: will load a config file for only that session, and not for the next execution of mRemoteNG even if /cons: is not specified?

comments.author: brolifen
comments.snippet:
> I'm unable to tell from the documentation: https://mremoteng.readthedocs.io/en/v1.77.3-dev/command_line_switches.html
> 
> Is the expectation that setting /cons: will load a config file for only that session, and not for the next execution of mRemoteNG even if /cons: is not specified?

I think so. However it fails to load it now at all not sure if I'm the only one having this issue with this build.

comments.author: BlueBlock
comments.snippet:
You are not the only one... the code for /cons looks to be disabled.

The disabled code sets the backup location to the value of /cons is a value is supplied. I'm thinking that would not be desired since it would impact and change the next running of mRemoteNG.

So if nobody objects, I'll make /cons be a completely temporary loading of a config, and with no change to the backup location.
